poem:
Title: "The Unexpected Triptych"

On the cusp of adulthood, restless soles trace
paths uncharted, part three without a two.
Stories untelling themselves, a dream-chase,
in Williams' world, identities anew.
Argentine alchemy through celluloid shows,
three groups wander, in hope and despair,
in blissful oblivion, each silently grows,
bound by the ties of a journey they share.
These vagabond tales where ends and beginnings blur,
An odyssey for the twenty-first-century wanderer.
